result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Nicholas James Pharo was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas James Pharo in court, in custody.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant completed RECAP.  Court grants regular huber.

To: defendant
Letter requesting sentence to be ran concurrent to jail time being served, in regards to fines.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Nicholas James Pharo in court in custody with attorney John k Smerlinski.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion on collateral attack on prior conviction is withdrawn by attorney Smerlinski. Exhibit 1 marked and identified. Presentence investigation reviewed, no factual corrections. COURT ORDERS: sentence withheld- 3 years probation w/conditions- 1 year Rock County jail with RECAP and huber for RECAP only. Upon successful completition of RECAP may petition the court for regular huber. No jail diversion. Fine/costs $1769- bond to apply, balance DOC collect during extended supervision and after first 180 days after release from custody. 24 months revocation & ignition interlock device, maintain absolute sobriety & employment. Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary. CREDIT: 67 days credit if revoked. Felony warnings given.
